# Terminology

## RFC 2119 Keywords

<!-- @source from="docs/ARCHITECTURE.md" as="rfc-2119-keywords" -->
- **MUST** = **REQUIRED** = **MANDATORY** = **SHALL** - Absolute requirement
- **MUST NOT** = **SHALL NOT** - Absolute prohibition
- **SHOULD** = **RECOMMENDED** - Highly desirable (may ignore with justification)
- **SHOULD NOT** = **NOT RECOMMENDED** - Not advisable (may do with justification)
- **MAY** = **OPTIONAL** - Truly optional (implementer decides)
<!-- @/source -->

See [ARCHITECTURE.md Section 2.2 Architecture Strategy](../../docs/ARCHITECTURE.md#22-architecture-strategy) for RFC 2119 keyword application.

## Emphasis Keywords

<!-- @source from="docs/ARCHITECTURE.md" as="emphasis-keywords" -->
- **CRITICAL** - Historically regression-prone areas requiring extra attention
- **ALWAYS** / **NEVER** - Emphatic MUST / MUST NOT (no exceptions)
<!-- @/source -->

See [ARCHITECTURE.md Section 1.3 Core Principles](../../docs/ARCHITECTURE.md#13-core-principles) for emphasis keyword usage in quality requirements.

## Abbreviations

<!-- @source from="docs/ARCHITECTURE.md" as="abbreviations" -->
**CRITICAL: NEVER use ambiguous `auth` abbreviation to mean either authentication or authorization**

- **authn** = Authentication
- **authz** = Authorization

**Rationale**: Prevents confusion filenames, variable names, and documentation.
<!-- @/source -->

See [ARCHITECTURE.md Section 2.2 Architecture Strategy](../../docs/ARCHITECTURE.md#22-architecture-strategy) for terminology standards and naming conventions.
